newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway Mongstad oil terminal handles record cargoe.
newsitem.headline: Norway Mongstad oil terminal handles record cargoe.

text.p: Den norske stats oljeselskap ASA said on Thursday the Mongstad oil terminal on the west coast of Norway had dealt with a record number of ships and cargoes in 1996.
Around 53.5 million tonnes of crude and oil products passed through Mongstad's jetties in the 12-month period, Statoil's Status Weeekly newsletter said.
Mongstad is Norway's largest port in terms of tonnage and is Europe's second largest oil port after Rotterdam in the Netherlands, it said.
Crude oil imports totalled 20.6 million tonnes, while exports topped 25 million tonnes. The volume of oil products moved during the year was around 7.9 million tonnes.

Ship calls totalled 1,870. Crude carriers accounted for 386 calls, including 185 for imports and 201 for exports. Forty-nine of the tankers were above 150,000 dead-weight tonnes, with the largest at 315,700 tonnes.
